thread.title: Edmonton Eskimos top Calgary Stampeders, pull even in West standings
thread.title_full: Edmonton Eskimos top Calgary Stampeders, pull even in West standings | Toronto Star

author: Donna Spencer
title: Edmonton Eskimos top Calgary Stampeders, pull even in West standings
text:
CALGARY—The race for first place in the CFL’s West Division tightened with the Edmonton Eskimos’ 15-11 win over the Calgary Stampeders on Saturday.
The Eskimos pulled even with the Stampeders at 11-4 atop the division. Edmonton secured a home playoff game with the victory although both teams were already assured playoff berths heading into the game. Calgary had already secured a home playoff matchup while both teams have three games to play in the regular season.
The Eskimos take the season series between the provincial rivals with a 2-1 record, which is the tiebreaker should both clubs have the same record at the regular season’s conclusion.
The team that finishes first in the division hosts the division final and has a bye week before that game.
The Stampeders suffered their first loss in eight home games this season and their three-game winning streak came to an end. The Eskimos have won five in a row for the first time since 2011 when they opened 5-0.
Kenny Stafford had a touchdown catch for the Eskimos with Sean Whyte kicking two field goals, a convert and a pair of punt singles in the low-scoring affair.
Eric Rogers caught a touchdown pass for Calgary. Running back Jon Cornish added a two-point convert. Rob Maver booted three punt singles and had one negated because of a Stampeder penalty.
Eskimos quarterback Mike Reilly completed 29 of 40 passes for 264 yards and a touchdown. Stampeder starter Bo Levi Mitchell was 17-for-30 in passing for 230 yards and a touchdown throw.
Edmonton improved to 9-1 when holding opponents to 19 points or less
The Stampeders marching into Edmonton territory late in the fourth quarter, Mitchell was intercepted by Cauchy Muamba on a throw intended for Marquay McDaniel with a minute and a half remaining in the game.
Maver’s 64-yard punt single was the lone point of the third quarter, but Whyte replied with one from 50 yards at 1:36 of the fourth to restore a four-point cushion for Edmonton.
Trailing 14-1 with just 35 total yards on offence late in the second quarter, Calgary came to life with nine points in the last two minutes of the half.
Mitchell capped a five-play, 65-yard drive with a 30-yard touchdown throw to Rogers in the end zone. Cornish produced the two-point convert on a one-yard plunge at 13:32. Maver added a 78-yard punt single.
On the final play of the half, Reilly was intercepted by former Eskimo Brandon McDonald airmailing to Derel Walker in the end zone.
Whyte kicked a 43-yard field goal for Edmonton at 12:38 of the second quarter.
Defensive back John Ogo picked off Mitchell for his fifth pick this season and gave the Esks the ball on Calgary’s 42-yard line.
The visitors parlayed the turnover into a touchdown with Stafford fighting off Stampeder safety Jamar Wall in the end zone for a 33-yard catch at 6:42.
After a 58-yard punt single from Maver early in the first quarter, Whyte put the visitors up 3-1 with a 30-yard field goal at 10:50. Whyte’s 57-yard single at 4:32 of the second quarter made it 4-1 for the Esks.
